intro: Arisaema heterocephalum var. okinawaense, commonly known as the Okinawan arrowhead, is a unique variant of the arisaema genus native to Japan. It is characterized by its distinctive, arrow-shaped leaves and a striking, spadix-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. Its botanical features include a tuberous rhizome and showy, umbellate flowers that attract pollinators. This variant is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological traits.
